item.title: Letter sent to Lakemba Mosque threatening violence on Australia Day investigated by police
item.description: The note, seen by the ABC, incited violence against several groups, including Middle Eastern communities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and a number of political figures from Labor, the Greens and "socialists" were also singled out.

item.title: US officials tout 'New Gaza' plans filled with shiny luxury skyscrapers
item.description: US officials have presented their vision for a "New Gaza" that would turn the shattered Palestinian territory into a glitzy resort of skyscrapers by the sea.

item.title: Track temperatures as heatwave sweeps across Australia
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

item.title: Who is the Neo-Nazi who was booed at Hobart's March for Australia rally?
item.description: With the organisers of March for Australia rallies saying they "are in no way concerned by the presence" of members of the National Socialist Network, the ABC can confirm a Tasmanian man whose words were too extreme for many in the Hobart crowd is believed to be a leader within the state's Neo-Nazi movement.

item.title: Labor identity Tim Picton remembered at Perth Stadium memorial service
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among political figures and business leaders who travel across the country to pay their respects to Mr Picton.

item.title: Federal Court finds extended Victoria Police stop-and-search declaration was unlawful and invalid
item.description: The Federal Court has found a Victoria Police move to give officers greater powers in Melbourne's CBD for six months was invalid and unlawful.

item.title: What is a landslide, how do they happen and where are they most common?
item.description: Two people have died after a landslide hit their home in New Zealand and authorities are searching for several others feared dead in another slip nearby. Here's how landslides occur, the warning signs and where they are most common.

item.title: How to attract native wildlife and birds to your garden
item.description: There are simple things we can all do to encourage more native wildlife to our gardens, backyards, balconies and shared spaces.

item.title: Video of bull shark washed up on Brisbane River bank sparks debate over AI technology
item.description: A video posted to social media of a bull shark washed up in the Brisbane River went viral and prompted speculation that it was AI-generated, but experts say it appears to be legitimate.

item.title: Former Broome pub manager jailed for six years over rape of staff member
item.description: Stewart Patrick Burchell is jailed for six years, found guilty by jury trial of raping a staff member and indecently assaulting several others.

item.title: Bail accommodation facility for women opens in Alice Springs
item.description: There are hopes the Salvation Army-run facility will keep women safe and help them reintegrate into the community while easing pressure on the prison system.

item.title: Lake Cargelligo residents in shock after three people shot dead
item.description: Residents of a remote NSW town of just 1,500 residents have expressed shock at a deadly shooting spree where three people were shot dead.

item.title: UK government says new passport rules designed with national security in mind
item.description: The requirement for dual British citizens to have a valid UK passport while entering the country would help prevent the arrival of people who present a threat, Australia's British High Commission says.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Fatigue a concern as massive fires continue to burn across southern WA
item.description: DFES says there have been no confirmed property losses as the battle to contain fires near Boddington and Wandering continues.

item.title: Yulia Putintseva taunts Zeynep Sönmez's Australian Open supporters
item.description: Kazakhstan's Yulia Putintseva happily plays the role of villain following her three-set win over Zeynep Sönmez at the Australian Open.

item.title: Japanese PM Sanae Takaichi dissolves parliament after only three months in office, setting up snap election
item.description: Japan's prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, has dissolved the lower house of parliament, paving the way for a snap election on February 8.

item.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
item.description: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

item.title: Lawyers call for Australian investigation into Israeli President Isaac Herzog amid genocide allegations
item.description: The Australian Centre for International Justice has formally requested a police investigation into Israel's president for alleged incitement to genocide. He is expected to visit to Australia next month.

item.title: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman charged with assault after Geraldton fracas
item.description: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman is charged with causing grievous bodily harm following an incident in Geraldton in late December.

item.title: Drowning most likely cause of death of Canadian backpacker Piper James on K'gari, coroner says
item.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds that while Piper James was bitten by dingoes before she died on K'gari, drowning is the most likely cause of death.

item.title: Steve Smith delivers again as Sixers down Hurricanes to cruise into BBL decider
item.description: Steve Smith top scores for the fifth time in as many innings as the Sixers down the Hurricanes to book a place in Sunday's BBL decider in Perth.

item.title: UK PM Keir Starmer demands Donald Trump apologise for 'appalling' claim NATO troops swerved front line
item.description: Donald Trump criticised NATO during a Fox News interview on Thursday, saying the US had "never needed" the alliance.

item.title: Ukrainian, Russian and US officials meet for first trilateral talks to end war in Ukraine
item.description: The Abu Dhabi talks mark the first known trilateral meeting between the countries since Moscow launched its invasion of Ukraine more than four years ago.

item.title: Hottest 100 quiz: How well do you remember past countdowns?
item.description: While you wait to hear who is number one this year, test your memory of past Hottest 100 countdowns.

item.title: As Russia's war intensifies Europe is exploring military and economic independence
item.description: As the world's elite gathered in Davos, European leaders confronted a reality in which they might need to defend themselves, and potentially against, the United States.

item.title: From ultimatum to implosion: How the Coalition went its separate ways
item.description: Dissecting the implosion of the Coalition and figuring out what comes next has become a full-time vocation for the newly emancipated Liberals and Nationals.

item.title: US copied Iran's Shahed drones — now they are deployed in the Middle East
item.description: The US copied Iran's Shahed 136 drone. Now, as Donald Trump threatens military action against the regime, analysts say the US could soon use Iran's weapons technology against it.

item.title: Prince Harry takes on the Daily Mail in High Court privacy showdown
item.description: The Duke of Sussex takes on the publisher he believes poisoned his childhood, his marriage, and his peace of mind in a legal battle driven by anger as well as principle.

item.title: Search for Julian Ingram enters third day following Lake Cargelligo shooting
item.description: A gunman accused of killing three people and seriously injuring another in New South Wales' Central West may be receiving help to evade authorities, police say.

item.description: Residents in WA's West Kimberley are being warned to prepare for days of wild weather, with a tropical cyclone forming up off the region's coast.

item.description: Alex de Minaur is back in familiar territory, on the cusp of the Australian Open quarterfinals, but he is adamant he can make a deeper run at Melbourne Park than his previous appearances.

item.title: Australia smash Sri Lanka by nine wickets to stay unbeaten at Under-19s Cricket World Cup
item.description: Australia have continued their dominant run through the Under-19s Cricket World Cup with Will Byrom's 5-14 leading the way in a nine-wicket win over Sri Lanka in their final group match.

item.description: A number of historic landmarks across Victoria's east have been given protective cover in case a nearby bushfire breaks containment lines.

item.description: Scientists are rushing to contain an emerging outbreak of coral-eating crown-of-thorns starfish on the Great Barrier Reef, warning it could be one of the worst in 60 years.

item.description: South Australia's hottest weather in six years creates dangerous bushfire conditions, which the head of the Country Fire Service says are "as serious as it gets".

item.description: Parts of south-east Australia are enduring severe heatwaves with fire warnings in place over the long weekend, as the Bureau of Meteorology issues a tropical cyclone warning for Western Australia.

item.title: Ross River Virus cases quadruple in South Australia in 2025
item.description: There were more than four times the number of Ross River Virus cases in South Australia in 2025 compared to 2024, prompting a new public health awareness campaign.

item.description: With a tank of zebrafish, Queensland researcher Jean Giacomotto was able to test a never-before seen genetic variant affecting two babies.

item.description: Salsa is not just for tacos. It's the perfect summer pasta sauce and makes the most of juicy summer tomatoes.

item.description: Play will start earlier on Saturday, with temperatures in Melbourne set to reach 40 degrees Celsius.

item.title: Sole survivor of Lake Cargelligo shooting opens up on the moment violence erupted
item.description: Nineteen-year-old Kaleb Macqueen was working on his car in the quiet NSW outback town of Lake Cargelligo last Thursday when violence erupted.

item.title: 2026 Local Hero Frank Mitchell accepts honour
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australia Day Honours List 2026: Meet some of the people inspiring the nation
item.description: From champion athletes to those working to help our most vulnerable, the 2026 Australia Day Honours List showcases the very best of the nation.

item.title: Keynes's Bancor idea needs revisiting in wake of Trump
item.description: In the wake of Trump, the world will now have to revisit the conference that set up the "rules-based world order".

item.title: Could you be working on unrealistic life goals?
item.description: Experts say knowing when to abandon or change your goals may be just as important as persistence.

item.title: From pod people to nuclear fallout, these Adelaidians tried to predict the future
item.description: I had been trawling absent-mindedly through the ABC's internal digital archive in a vague search for inspiration and clicked on this file called "Letters to the Unborn" at random.

item.title: Moderate Liberals 'rock solid' behind Sussan Ley amid leadership whispers
item.description: While conservatives Angus Taylor and Andrew Hastie canvass support to challenge for the Liberal leadership, moderates say there is no mood for turning on Sussan Ley — meaning a spill would likely result in another divided vote.

item.title: Temperatures to exceed 40C in several parts of the country on Australia Day
item.description: Record-breaking temperatures above 40 degrees Celsius will be experienced in several parts of Australia from today.

item.title: ICE agents urged to leave Minneapolis after second fatal shooting
item.description: It is the second death in Minneapolis linked to the Trump administration's immigration crackdown.

item.title: Support services on alert as Adelaide possibly facing its hottest Australia Day
item.description: South Australians are being advised to stay aware of the impacts of a "significant heatwave", as Adelaide prepares to swelter through what could be its hottest Australia Day on record.

item.title: Australia Day honour for former South Australian premier Steven Marshall
item.description: The former South Australian premier joins other state leaders from the COVID era in being recognised with an Order of Australia award.

item.title: Learner Tien's bloody nose, Iva Jovic arrives and Carlos Alcaraz's debt to Novak Djokovic — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: On a day of blowout wins, Learner Tien could only be slowed by his own nosebleed and Iva Jovic proved she is a superstar of the future. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: After years of playing nice, Alex de Minaur is done being polite ahead of Australian Open quarterfinal
item.description: After years of playing nice, Alex de Minaur is done hearing all the noise, and has put himself in position to reach somewhere he's never been.

item.title: ShareSorted properties still up for rent despite being deemed 'not habitable' by NSW tribunal
item.description: Furnished accommodation company ShareSorted was found in breach of its obligations related to at least two properties, but a lack of regulation allows them to continue to operate.

item.title: The Five Islands Nature Reserve
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Explorers Bass and Flinders named five Illawarra islands after themselves
item.description: Home to migratory sea birds, seals and penguins, the history of Wollongong's five islands goes back well beyond Bass and Flinders.

item.title: How the Atlas Network is shaping your life, even if you've never heard of it
item.description: A constant battle of ideas reshapes the world we live in, and few groups have been more successful in winning the war than the little-known Atlas Network.

item.title: What does the rise of digital devices and decline of handwriting mean for how we live and learn?
item.description: Most of the learning done in schools these days is digital, but experts say handwriting still plays an important role in the development of thinking, learning, and fine motor skills.

item.title: Brisbane temperatures tops 35 degrees as Cairns and Townsville face soaking rain
item.description: South-east Queensland is sweating through its hottest Australia Day so far this century, with Brisbane recording its highest maximum temperature since 1998.

item.title: Removal of old Bridgewater Bridge marks 'sad point' for Tasmania's rail history, advocates say
item.description: As the old Bridgewater Bridge is removed piece by piece, so too is the opportunity for passenger and heritage rail connections to some of southern Tasmania's fastest-growing residential areas.

item.title: National Film and Sound Archive's restoration of Mount Gambier edition of Life in Australia film given new life
item.description: The National Film and Sound Archive has released 4K restorations of the 1960s film series Life in Australia, commissioned by the Department of Immigration to attract new migrants to regional Australia.

item.title: Australian Open influencers are changing the grand slam's look, feel and experience for tennis fans
item.description: Many long-time tennis fans have levelled some frustration at the influx of influencers who have descended on Melbourne Park, as they battle long lines, overcrowding and increased ticket prices.

item.title: Rescuers recover more bodies but dozens still missing after landslide in Indonesia
item.description: Dozens of people remain missing — many feared buried under mud, rocks and uprooted trees — after a landslide on Indonesia's main island of Java.

item.title: More than 1,100 properties under evacuation warnings for Otways fire before extreme weather hits on Tuesday
item.description: Residents from more than 1,100 properties near Victoria's Otways bushfire have been asked to evacuate before sunset ahead of extreme fire conditions on Tuesday.

item.title: Videos of Minneapolis shooting appear to contradict Trump administration's claims
item.description: Multiple videos emerge of nurse Alex Pretti being pepper-sprayed, wrestled to the ground and then shot. The Trump administration says Mr Pretti was an armed man provoking violence.

item.title: Anthony is Boddington's 'underground' carer for orphaned joeys despite the licensing hurdles
item.description: Roofus is one of many orphaned kangaroos taken under the wing of unofficial wildlife carers, a vocation one Boddington local found in his adolescence.

item.title: Track temperatures live as Australia Day heatwave hits multiple states
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

item.title: Manhunt for Julian Ingram enters fifth day after Lake Cargelligo shooting
item.description: A pregnant woman who was one of three people shot dead in a suspected domestic violence attack in a remote NSW town has been remembered as a gentle and kind person.

item.title: Mercedes Cove coastal retreat home destroyed by Tropical Cyclone Luana
item.description: A family's home in WA's far north was "all but destroyed" by Tropical Cyclone Luana. The system, now a tropical low, is tracking inland across the Kimberley.

item.title: All top six seeds make quarterfinals for first time in the Open Era
item.description: The 2026 Australian Open will be the first grand slam that all top six seeds in the men's and women's singles have reached the quarterfinals in the Open Era.

item.title: Two men dead after drowning in Never Never River north of Bellingen
item.description: Two men have drowned and another remains in a stable condition in hospital after a mishap in a river on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

item.title: 18-year-old tennis player Iva Jović ready to face Australian Open favourite Aryna Sabalenka
item.description: Iva Jović refuses to be intimidated about facing two-time Australian Open champion Aryna Sabalenka in the quarterfinals at Melbourne Park.

item.title: What is life like in Delhi, one of the world's most polluted cities?
item.description: Poor air quality in Delhi has impacted nearly all aspects of life with residents saying they have lost many of the "simple joys" such as opening a window or going for a walk outside.

item.title: Parents of missing Queensland man Jack McLennan hopeful after meeting with police minister
item.description: The parents of missing Jack McLennan say they have drawn some comfort from a meeting with Queensland Police Minister Dan Purdie.

item.title: At least ten dead as winter storm grips much of US
item.description: A massive winter storm across much of the US, spreading from Texas all the way to New England, affects powerlines, traffic and air travel.

item.title: Witness footage shows lead-up to deadly shooting of Alex Pretti
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Video showing lead-up to Minneapolis shooting
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: US citizens are becoming collateral damage in Donald Trump's quest to deport immigrants
item.description: Minneapolis has become the flashpoint of an aggressive immigration enforcement operation ordered by the Trump administration and pitched as a campaign against undocumented criminals.

item.title: Potential explosive device thrown into crowd at Perth Invasion Day rally, police say
item.description: Police say they are investigating whether a device thrown into an Invasion Day rally crowd in Perth contained explosives, in addition to ball bearings and screws found inside.

item.title: Australia Day 2026 marked by citizenship ceremonies, traditional dances, fun runs and heatwave conditions
item.description: Communities across the country are marking Australia Day with citizenship ceremonies, traditional dances, smoking ceremonies and fun runs, as the prime minister calls for "unity not division" during a speech in Canberra.

item.title: Ferry carrying more than 300 people sinks in southern Philippines
item.description: Rescuers are searching for missing passengers and at least 18 are dead, after a ferry with more than 300 people onboard sunk in the southern Philippines.

item.title: Police arrest man as part of investigation into alleged sexual assault at Yeppen Lagoon
item.description: Police have taken a 27-year-old man into custody as part of their investigations after a woman was allegedly attacked on a popular walkway.

item.title: Gold's record run rolls on with prices surging past $US5,000 as investors seek safety
item.description: Gold surges to a record high above $US5,000 an ounce, extending a historic rally as investors pile into the safe-haven asset amid rising geopolitical tensions.

item.title: 'Dog in driver's seat' of ute on Tasmanian beach sparks call for witnesses
item.description: Reports of a "dog in the driver's seat" of a ute driving on a Tasmanian beach have prompted police to ask for witnesses to come forward.

item.title: Call for public information following home invasion
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police appeal for information after 54-year-old woman assaulted in Sale home invasion
item.description: Wellington Crime Investigation detectives turn to the public for help as they continue to investigate a 2025 home invasion where they allege three men broke in and assaulted a woman.

item.title: Timothée Chalamet on 'unlearning' everything he knew as an actor for Marty Supreme
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australian of the Year Katherine Bennell-Pegg reflects on space, STEM and the launch pad
item.description: The 2026 Australian of the Year — astronaut and space engineer Katherine Bennell-Pegg — is a strong advocate for STEM education, but fears too much talent is being left on the "launch pad".

item.title: Super Bowl LX match-up confirmed with Seattle Seahawks to play New England Patriots
item.description: New England survived a Denver blizzard and Seattle outlasted Los Angeles in an offensive shootout to set up a bumper clash for Super Bowl LX.

item.title: Animated movie Imagine invited 150 Indigenous kids to collaborate with stars like Taika Waititi
item.description: The beautifully animated, crowdsourced movie Imagine introduces a wealth of Indigenous knowledge to audiences in the funniest way possible and hopes to generate real change.

item.title: Traditional owners heartbroken over decision to cull K'gari dingoes involved in Piper James's death
item.description: The Queensland government euthanises six dingoes involved in Piper James's death on K'gari, and is expected to cull more in the coming days.

item.title: Australia Day heat record for Adelaide, as mercury hits 49C in Ceduna
item.description: As Adelaide sets a new record for its hottest Australia Day, other parts of SA are enduring conditions that are even more sweltering, with the mercury climbing above 49C in Ceduna.

item.title: Madison Keys's world hasn't ended now her Australian Open defence is over
item.description: There were no tears or tantrums once Madison Keys left Rod Laver Arena, knowing her Australian Open title defence had come to an end.

item.title: Quick and easy burger recipes for stress-free summer dinners
item.description: From chargrilled beef patties and beer-battered fish to vegetarian parmigiana and cheeseburger tray bake, we have burgers to suit all tastes and diets.

item.title: Call for memorial to Beaumont children, 60 years after they disappeared
item.description: Politician Frank Pangallo is calling for a permanent memorial to be installed at an Adelaide beach to acknowledge the disappearance of the Beaumont children in 1966.

item.title: Anti-immigration rallies take place in major cities across Australia
item.description: A 31-year-old has been arrested and charged by police for allegedly using hate speech "aligned with Neo-Nazi ideology" at an open mic session at the anti-immigration rally.

item.title: Worst heatwave in decades sending temperatures close to 50C over south-east Australia
item.description: A record heatwave across south-east Australia will peak during the coming days, leading to extreme fire danger and temperatures close to 50 degrees Celsius in multiple states.

item.title: Police confirm human remains found in north Queensland those of missing man Jayden Penno-Tompsett
item.description: Human remains found in north Queensland belong to a missing New South Wales man last seen eight years ago, according to police.

item.title: Travellers stranded at Nullarbor roadhouses as bushfire shuts Eyre Highway
item.description: A fire near Caiguna has blocked the major road link between Western Australia and the east coast.

item.title: Confusion and chaos at Perth Invasion Day rally as police respond to security threat
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Man dies after confrontation with police officers in Kalgoorlie
item.description: A 43-year-old man has died after an incident involving WA Police officers in South Kalgoorlie.

item.title: Gunmen open fire at soccer field in central Mexico, killing 11
item.description: Authorities say gunmen opened fire in the city of Salamanca, killing at least 11 people and wounding 12 at the end of a soccer match.

item.title: Government agency deliberately broke law for years, federal watchdog finds
item.description: Services Australia has known it was not fully complying with new child support laws since 2019, according to a scathing report released by the Commonwealth Ombudsman.

item.title: Remains of last Israeli hostage in Gaza, Ran Gvili, have been found, Benjamin Netanyahu says
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirmed that the remains of 24-year-old Ran Gvili had been found and identified.

item.title: Donald Trump sends 'border czar' Tom Homan to Minnesota after shooting of nurse Alex Pretti
item.description: An American citizen, Alex Pretti, was shot by federal agents during a continuing Trump administration immigration crackdown in the city.

item.title: Indonesian marines among at least 42 people missing in Indonesian landslide in West Java province
item.description: The search is ongoing for survivors after the pre-dawn landslide on the slopes of Mount Burangrang in West Java province killed at least two dozen people at the weekend.

item.title: Private jet crashes as major winter storm kills 13 across US
item.description: Almost 200 million Americans are under cold weather alerts as snow, sleet and freezing rain affects swathes of the country from Texas to New England, with temperatures set to fall dangerously low this week.

item.title: Russia, Ukraine and US plan further trilateral talks on ending war
item.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy said discussions between envoys from Ukraine, Russia and the US in Abu Dhabi last week aimed at ending Moscow's invasion left some political issues unresolved.
